definition: (main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture

sentences.english: After treatment in patients with open eyes to see, can be bright.
sentences.chinese: 医治后令患者展开眼睛，视物可立刻亮堂。

sentences.english: Already the moon shone quite clear on the high ground on either side.
sentences.chinese: 月亮已经把两侧的高地照得亮堂堂的。
这座庙被漆成亮堂堂的。

sentences.english: Electric lights lit up the basket-ball ground.
The house was alight with candles.
sentences.chinese: 屋子里点着蜡烛，亮堂堂的。

sentences.english: As long for diligently waiting above, the madam's in the mind bright hall can't diverge to us very.
sentences.chinese: 只要用心伺候，夫人心里亮堂的很，不会对我们差的。

sentences.english: That path would save many minutes, but he had never taken it---not even in the full light of noon.
sentences.chinese: 即便在阳光最亮堂的大白昼，他也没有走过。

sentences.english: There are four rooms in our flat, and mine is big and bright.
sentences.chinese: 家里有四个房间，我的房间又大又亮堂。

sentences.english: The white paint on the walls helps make the room look brighter.
sentences.chinese: 墙上的白漆有助于使房间显得亮堂。

sentences.english: It was warm in there and bright.
Electric lights lit up the basket-ball ground.
sentences.chinese: 电灯把篮球场照得亮堂堂的。

sentences.english: Two sisters, fair and bright; they always run, but never meet.
sentences.chinese: 姐妹两，亮堂堂，她们总在跑，但从来不碰面。

sentences.english: The car park at the basement is small and has limited parking space but well lighted up.
sentences.chinese: 地下停车场很小而且限制停车空间但是很亮堂。

sentences.english: The house is very bright and comfortable.
Most of the cats preferred bright light when they were active.
sentences.chinese: 大少数的猫在运动时都喜好亮堂的光照。

definition: lit. clear window and clean table (idiom)/fig. bright and clean
